question: List any limitations mentioned.
gold_answer: Existing research has not taken into account the insiders’ time-sequence-centric dynamic behavior, which limits effective detection with only static pattern-based methods

question: What dataset did the authors use for evaluation?
gold_answer: The Insider Threat Test Dataset developed by the Software Engineering Institute (SEI) at Carnegie Mellon University

question: What is the main conclusion of the document?
gold_answer: The proposed Hybrid GRU-CNN classification strategy achieved 98.43% accuracy in training (false positive rate 0.17%) and 97.12% accuracy in testing (false positive rate 2.88%), outperforming state-of-the-art methods for insider attack detection

question: What methods were used in the study?
gold_answer: A hybrid GRU (Gated Recurrent Unit) + CNN (Convolutional Neural Network) machine learning model for insider attack classification

question: Who are the authors of the paper?
gold_answer: Arul Selvam P (Assistant Professor, Dept. of CSE, Hindusthan College of Engineering and Technology, Coimbatore)
